body.name: REOLINK TrackMix LTE+SP - 4G LTE Cellular Security Camera Outdoor, Dual Lens, Auto Tracking, 6X Hybrid Zoom, 2K Color Night Vision, Support (Verizon/AT&T/T-Mobile), No WiFi Solar Powered Camera
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 3 hrs 36 mins
Or fastest pickup Tuesday, February 13. Order within 3 hrs 36 mins
features: Dual View on One Screen: With 6X hybrid zoom enabled by the wide-angle and telephoto lenses, this 4G security camera brings you a full view and a closeup of key details on one screen. You can see them both at one glance.

Covers Every Corner & Detail by PTZ Auto-Zoom Tracking: Control the camera to pan 355° and tilt 90° to see 360°. It can also track and zoom in on the moving object automatically, clearly showing you how the event unfolds.

Get Alerted to What Matters in Real Time: The camera can distinguish people, vehicles, and pets from other objects and provide relevant alerts. You'll get notified by email, app push, or siren immediately.
Crisp 2K Video Day & Night: With 2K 4MP high resolution, the dual lens sharply captures fine details. In the night, it provides infrared black-and-white night vision and spotlight color night vision.

3G/4G LTE Network & Forever Solar Power: The combination of the solar power panel and 4G connection on this cellular camera saves you from the troubles of finding sockets or networks outdoors Ideal for country houses, construction sites, etc.Compatible SIM card carriers: EIOT Club, T-Mobile (prepaid data card only), Freedompop, AT&T, Verizon. Note: Before using Verizon, please activate the SIM Card with your phone's IMEI and then insert it into the camera.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Using this camera to keep an eye on a remote piece of property located a few hours away. The motion tracking is exceptionally good (way better than I expected), the image is clear, and the video stable. I'm using a t-mobile prepaid SIM and at $10 for their 2gb plan, it's pretty affordable per camera. Set up was no muss no fuss - literally just popped a SIM and SD card in it, used the app to add it, and it was up and running. It hasn't fallen below 90% charge yet, even at night, and the build quality itself is pretty stout with the camera having a metal body. I do wish the mount for the camera itself wasn't plastic, but I've got it secured to a tree with some decking screws, so I don't anticipate anything being able to get to it.It's so good thus far, that I just ordered another one. I'll come back and update this review if anything changes for better or worse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Cellular Camera
reviews.reviewText: I have been through many different brands, trying to get the best cellular camera for my jobsites. I bought my last cell camera a week ago, it did not work with an AT&T Sim Card. I called ATT once and went to their store three times trying to get it to work. It advertised that it would work with multiple sim cards, but it only worked with the one provided. I put the same sim card in this camera and it worked instantly! Everything you would want in a cellular camera, this does. You can use it on your phone and laptop, it has 2 different camera lenses at the same time.. one that is wide and another that is zoom, remote use of: spotlight, siren, move camera up, down, left, right, will record on an SD card (that you have to buy separately), or their cloud service (which I did not purchase). It was well worth the money! I have had it up for 24 hours, I will update if it does not hold up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lots of settings
reviews.reviewText: I bought one, really liked it so I bought another. The second one would not set up so I returned for replacement. Now after a month or so I can say that I'm happy with them both.They're at our farm a few miles away so we can keep an eye on things. The visibility is great both day and night. Speaker has a tweet sound but I won't be using that much. I'm still tweeking the settings to get less alerts for small birds and such. Overall it's a nice camera with lots of features.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Stopped working after 30 days!! NO support from company!! Stay away
reviews.reviewText: Set up was easy. Excellent quality overall. Good user interface. Camera died unexpectedly after 30 days. I contacted the company directly but unfortunately they do not care about the customers and support is nonexistent. I tried several times and it’s a complete waste of time. I was very excited to use this camera because the quality built and video is excellent. Grateful for Amazon customer service for making it right.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars WARNING - This product should be approached with caution
reviews.reviewText: This product was not compatible with Verizon. I visited two different Verizon locations to confirm this. Eventually (this took several hours), AT&T was able to provide a pre-paid SIM card. On the camera, the SIM cover plate screws are soft and easily stripped. I had to go to great lengths (using two different screwdrivers and pliers) to remove it. Once a SIM card was inserted, the camera would not activate. It told me to reinsert the SIM. I tried to do that but could not get the SIM card to eject. I took it to AT&T and they could not get it out either. When I called Reolink technical support (3 times), they did not pick up the phone and only provided an automated answer stating that they were unavailable to take my call.The email support was very good and I was able to communicate with them as needed to address the problems.Update: I received a full refund for this product but the pre-paid card money is lost.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: We already had a 4G PTZ Reolink camera for our driveway to my shop/office but when they came out with the TrackMix 4G we ordered it immediately and we absolutely love it for my shop/office absolutely love the Track Feature & also it let's you know what set it off Vehicle, Animal, PersonWe use T Mobile for our cellular provider for the camera & its 20$ a month unlimited & the serviceis flawless & we're way off in the woods in a rural area & it works great the solar panel always keeps it chargedWe have another brand camera for around our home & they need updated we've had them a min so we will be upgrading to the wifi with solar panels TrackMixWould Highley Recommend this camera or any of the Reolink CameraCustomer Service is absolutely amazing 💯Reolink is #1 in our bookA+++++++++++++++++++++++++

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just about perfect!
reviews.reviewText: I bought one just to work with my Go PT around my property and so far I am impressed. I would say it is a huge upgrade. I actually bought 2 of them. Partially to retire the Go PT which I will get in to a little bit in the cons. If I can get it to work, the Go PT will live another day. Assuming Freedompop will work again... Go with EIOT Club for the SIM card. It will work immediately.Pros: Metal housing is a huge bonus. Dual lens is pretty awesome. Active tracking is pretty neat too. Will have to play around with settings. The best thing I have found so far is the pre set views. Rather than pan and tilt to a point which takes time, set it once and it's like speed dial. It goes to those points really quick.Cons: Though the panel to access the power switch has captive screws, the SD card panel is not. I guarantee you I will lose those screws at some point. The antennas are built in. This is one of the reasons I am retiring the Go PT. Though that antenna can be replaced, it literally crumbled after being exposed to the Florida sun for a year and a half. That is my biggest concern.I am really excited to see this camera in action for security, hog damage monitoring, and time lapses during hurricanes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars So much to love... but solar panel could be better...or is the battery?
reviews.reviewText: I LOVE so much about this camera... the pictures are amazing, tracking is oh so cool, and the dual lens comes in handy many times. But... solar isn't working well in winter.... in Florida. I don't know if the panel is subpar or the battery storage... but we're going to have to plug in for periods... and that was the entire thing we hoped to avoid with the solar setup. We're worried that prolonged plug in will damage the battery too. Just a tough situation where one should not exist.
